definition: kalpa (loanword) (Hinduism)
to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
wave/ripple/storm/surge

sentences.english: After the Battle of Endor, the Wookiees were finally afforded their freedoms.
sentences.chinese: 恩多戰役以後，伍基人渡盡劫波，重獲自由。

definition: to have experienced a lot of/to have been through
variant of 磨難|磨难[mo2 nan4]
to have been through the hardships of life/to have been through the mill
to torture/to torment
variant of 涅槃[nie4 pan2]
the past/impurity contracted previously (in the sentient world) (Buddhism)
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
fully aware/to recognize fully
a torment/a trial/tribulation/a cross (to bear)/well-tried
nirvana (Buddhism)
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
to achieve supreme enlightenment or nirvana (Buddhism)
lit. having crossed the vast ocean (idiom)/fig. widely experienced in the vicissitudes of life
see 看破[kan4 po4]
lit. to make one's way through a dangerous pass as if walking on level ground (idiom)/fig. to handle a crisis effortlessly
ups and downs (of life etc)/to drift along/to sink and emerge
